notes: A man who can't breathe comes to Doctor Condorito. Condorito thinks he may have a fish bone ("espina") caught in his throat, but the man's a vegetarian. Condorito then suspects spinach ("espinaca").

111.title: "I Don't Think It'll be Necessary to use Labor-Breathing Techniques"
111.author: Armstrong.
notes: Summary: The orthodontist Dr. Tomahawk tells Jenny she may experience discomfort when he tightens the braces.

112.heading: Breathing.
112.title: "The Mercenary"
112.author: Segrelles
112.appears_in: p. 87-91 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 2 (May 1982).
notes: Summary: A flame dies and a balloon with a city below it rises; The Mercenary escapes with the girl to his own country and accidentally destroys the Overlord's castle. The girl leaves for her country, where the air is too thin for The Mercenary to breathe without a potion.

113.heading: Breathing.
113.title: "Most of his Breathing is Sighing"
113.author: by Mort Walker.
notes: Key words: Golf, romance, martinis, aging.

114.heading: Breathing.
114.title: "Noble Effort"
114.author: by Blosser.
notes: Summary: Lard's body doesn't come up for two minutes, and they spot the soda straw he's been breathing through.

115.heading: Breathing.
115.title: "Show Me Something Offensive"
115.author: Mike Peters.
notes: Summary: Grimmy breathes on his martial arts instructor.

116.heading: Breathing.
116.title: "That Should Keep Him Occupied for a Few Hours"
116.author: by Kieran Meehan.
116.series: A Lawyer, a Doctor & a Cop, Apr. 10, 2006
notes: Summary: The cop tells his prisoner to "breathe deeply and count to ten."

117.title: Breathless [realia]
117.author: [No author]
notes: 1 t-shirt : col. ill. ; size 12.
Imprint (except date) from label.
Color portrait of Madonna as Breathless Mahoney in the movie Dick Tracy, in blue outline star on red background.

118.title: Breathtaker
118.author: created, written & painted by Mark Wheatley ; designed, drawn & lettered by Mark Hempel ; painting & lettering assisted by Kathryn Mayer ; edited by Mike Gold.
notes: Complete in 4 nos.
Story about a genetically engineered succubus.
Genre: Horror.

119.author: by Mark Wheatley and Marc Hempel ; introduction by Neil Gaiman.
notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 27 cm.
(Vertigo)
"Originally published in single magazine form as Breathtaker 1-4."
